bill.title: Planned Community Associations; Proxy Statements; Requirements
bill.description: Amends various proxy statement requirements for planned community associations to promote communication from prospective board of directors candidates to all owners when proxies are used for elections of directors; standardize the proxy form; and prohibit managing agents, resident managers, and employees thereof from soliciting or casting proxy votes at meetings for the same association that employs their services unless it is for the purpose of establishing quorum. Applies to proxy statements for meetings of an association occurring on or after October 1, 2016. (SD1)

history.action: Prefiled.
Introduced and Pass First Reading.
Referred to CPC, JUD, referral sheet 1
Bill scheduled to be heard by CPC on Monday, 02-01-16 2:00PM in House conference room 325.
The committee(s) on CPC recommend(s) that the measure be deferred until 02-03-16 2:00PM.
Bill scheduled for decision making on Wednesday, 02-03-16 2:00PM in conference room 325.

The committees on CPC recommend that the measure be PASSED, WITH AMENDMENTS. The votes were as follows: 12 Ayes: Representative(s) McKelvey, Woodson, Belatti, Brower, Har, Hashem, Kawakami, San Buenaventura, Takayama, Yamane, Fukumoto Chang, McDermott; Ayes with reservations: none; Noes: none; and 4 Excused: Representative(s) Creagan, C. Lee, Nakashima, Oshiro.
Reported from CPC (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 257-16) as amended in HD 1, recommending passage on Second Reading and referral to JUD.
Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on JUD with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Tokioka excused (1).
Bill scheduled to be heard by JUD on Thursday, 03-03-16 2:00PM in House conference room 325.
Broadcast of hearing/briefing available. See: www.capitoltv.org

The committees on JUD recommend that the measure be PASSED, UNAMENDED. The votes were as follows: 14 Ayes: Representative(s) Rhoads, San Buenaventura, Belatti, Brower, Creagan, Hashem, Kawakami, C. Lee, Morikawa, Nakashima, Takayama, Woodson, McDermott, Thielen; Ayes with reservations: none; Noes: none; and Excused: none.
Reported from JUD (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 985-16), recommending passage on Third Reading.
Passed Third Reading with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and none excused (0). Transmitted to Senate.
Received from House (Hse. Com. No. 189).
Passed First Reading.
Referred to CPH.
The committee(s) on CPH has scheduled a public hearing on 03-29-16 9:00AM in conference room 229.
The committee(s) on CPH deferred the measure until 04-01-16 10:00AM in conference room 229.

The committee(s) on CPH recommend(s) that the measure be PASSED, WITH AMENDMENTS. The votes in CPH were as follows: 4 Aye(s): Senator(s) Baker, Kidani, Espero, Nishihara; Aye(s) with reservations: none ; 0 No(es): none; and 3 Excused: Senator(s) Ihara, Ruderman, Slom.
Reported from CPH (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 3331) with recommendation of passage on Second Reading, as amended (SD 1) and placement on the calendar for Third Reading.
Report adopted; Passed Second Reading, as amended (SD 1).
48 Hrs. Notice 04-07-16.
Passed Third Reading, as amended (SD 1). Ayes, 22; Aye(s) with reservations: none . Noes, 0 (none). Excused, 3 (Senator(s) Harimoto, Slom, L. Thielen). Transmitted to House.
Returned from Senate (Sen. Com. No. 464) in amended form (SD 1).
House disagrees with Senate amendment (s).
Received notice of disagreement (Hse. Com. No. 468).
Senate Conferees Appointed: Baker Chair; Kidani, Nishihara.
Received notice of Senate conferees (Sen. Com. No. 656).
Reconsideration of action taken on 04-08-16.
Received notice of House reconsideration of action in disagreeing to the amendments proposed by the Senate (Hse. Com. No. 633).
House agrees to Senate amendment(s).
Passed Final Reading as amended in SD 1 with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Ing, Oshiro excused (2).
Received notice of House agreement and passage on Final Reading (Hse. Com. No. 658).
Transmitted to Governor.
